content: wavy baby blanket it s time for another stash busting baby blankie this time it s a modified feather and fan stitch you can find this stitch in a treasury of knitting patterns by barbara walker and throughout the internet basically i eliminated the purl row this makes for a reversible blanket a sought-after feature in any blanket size approximately 28-inch square this is an easily modifiable pattern so you can knit the blanket to your desired size gauge not critical for this item i prefer to use a needle that is two sizes larger than recommended on the yarn label materials ● worsted weight yarn for the blanket pictured i used one skein each of red heart super saver in turquoise soft white grey heather and black ● us 10/6 0 mm 36-inch circular needles ● yarn needle abbreviations ● k2tog knit two stitches together one stitch decreased right slant ● ssk slip one stitch knitwise slip one stitch knitwise bring both back to left needle and knit through back loop one stitch decreased left slant ● yo yarn over wrap the yarn over your needle and continue with pattern i love knittinghelp com for thorough descriptions and easy-paced videos to learn new techniques take a peek at their decreases and yarn over videos instructions co 110 or any multiple of 18 stitches plus 2 row 1 knit all stitches row 2 knit all stitches row 3 k1 *k2tog 3x yo k1 6x ssk 3x* repeat from * to * 5 times more k1 row 4 knit all stitches row 5 knit all stitches row 6 knit all stitches repeat row 3-6 to desired length weave in ends wash and dry enjoy with your favourite baby notes and tips for a smooth edge i really like smooth edges for blankets so at the beginning of each row i slip the first stitch purlwise this means for row 3 i slip the first stitch purlwise and this replaces the k1 changing colours in the sample photo i changed colours on a row 5
